Entry.1:
Sea Smooth. A.D.H. held Boxing Match. Ship’s staff gave concert in F Ward. Nurses provided chocolates.

Mrs. C.P. Browne

37 Thurlley Rd.

Wembley

Middlesex

England
Entry.2: Church Parade & Sacred Concert at night. Troop-Deck Sergeant.
Entry.5: Half-way between Fremantle & Suez. Mock trial. Bob Carter Clarke.
Entry.6: Crossed the line early this morning.
Entry.11: Put in the cells for disobeying the guard. Guard gets into Hot Water & I go free.
Entry.12: Halfway between Fremantle & Suez. Mock Trial.
Entry.19: Left Suez at 7 a.m. for Cairo. Arrived at Abbassia at 4 p.m.
Entry.20: Watched Dressing in Morning & started work at 2 p.m.
Entry.22: Went to Cairo for first time. Met C. Board & McDonnell. Came home in Chariot with H. O’Keefe & Roy Farnsworth, Geoff Clarke. A Gallop all the way.
Entry.23: Ward work & no spell even for a shower.
Entry.24: Continue in ward work & Operation Theatre
Entry.25: Still continue. Wrote to Marg Millar.
Entry.26: Wrote Home & sent a few cards. Wrote to Cohen’s.
Entry.27: Ellis & I with Staff Moore, L.C. Winn & Sergt. McIvor went to Pyramids followed by tea at Y.M.C.A.
Entry.28: Harold Filshie, Roland Hale & Eric Davis came up to see us.
Entry.29: Had a letter from Roy Tredrea.
Entry.30: Wrote to Amy Cocks. Duty from 6.30 p.m. till 11 p.m. starts. Dulce, H. Hey, H. Hickson.
Entry.34: Ivy, Mrs. Clarks, Ida & Walter, Mrs. Stephen.
Entry.46: Mrs. Whitehead, May Coppin, Jess Mather.
Entry.50: E. Fryer, Lily Porman, E. Tory, Kit Green, Esme Preddey.
Entry.51: Visited No. 2 General at Ghezerah . Nurse Gould with Afternoon Tea.
Entry.53: Mrs. Melville, Mrs. Dobson, Grandma Nicholls, Ruby Watson, Bess, Grace Farrington.
Entry.57: Flo. Tupper, Roy Tredrea, Gwen McEwen.
Entry.59: George, Grandma Davies, Nettie, Marie Liversey, Mother, Mr. Love.
Entry.61: Dad. Broke Camp & was caught in Heliopolis.
Entry.62: Marie Liversey, Jennie. Cairo & met Ces. Turner & Bosanberg.
Entry.63: Took Photos of Ward Gates & Hospital.
Entry.65: Went to Barage. Lovely gardens & good & bad donkey rides. Staff Moore, McIvor, Vin Devaney, Billie A., Ellis & I, Billie B.
Entry.67: Dad & Mother, Mary Westy. Reinforcement from No. 2 Gen. arrived, 60 & 4 Doctors. Cois Cateer . Milford Brothers work with Ellis.
Entry.68: Route March to Gizeh . Went to Kursaal & saw Picture & People acting together. Photo of P.C.
Entry.69: Spring Beds issued or rather taken.
Entry.70: More Wireless going. Boulogne our Destination?
Entry.71: Nothing I can make a note of. Just work but having easy time with 3 orderlies.
Entry.72: Bill, Ellis & I went to Mary’s well & Virgin’s Tree & to Kursaal after tea.
Entry.73: Dave Niness took Photo E. R. I. Roy & I went to Kursaal together. Roy came out to dinner but got very little. Came down to my ward to talk to Corbett.
Entry.74:
Ward-master.

Home, Nettie, Bess, Laura, Nell & Pa, Ma, Cock & Ida.

Went to Pyramids & round the Houses of Cairo. Bill, Dave, Charlie & E. & I. Rode from Mena in motor car.
Entry.75: Met Johhno & went to Pictures. Special leave from 5 to 10.
Entry.77: Went to Blue Mosque. Met Roy in Gardens, Tea at Café de la Paix. Tea Misrquash. Roy, Dave Niness & I went to Pictures. Pictures Misrquash. Pictures Colosse.
Entry.78: Our Theatre Experts gave concert in Esbekiah Gardens.
Entry.79: Adieu to Roy & Jack & T. Master. Sick in bed all day. Wrote Aunt Alice, Amy, Bess, Jess Mather, Dobbo’s, Home.
Entry.80:
Mrs. Merrett, Home.

Ellis & Billy went to Cairo after tea to get films & paper. Last lot of lettres posted at Esbekiah Gardens. Still in Bed.
Entry.81: Got up at 2 p.m. & went to Ward. Inspection. Bust up. Kicked out to Treatment Hut.
Entry.82: Sick Parade. Irrigation Tent all day. Ward Master. 4 cases. 1st time for any cases at all. Watered floor with medicine.
Entry.83: Took charge of Bubo’s in Ellis’ Hut. Night on Irrig. Patients. Roll Call 9.30. Reinforcements arrived (15).
Entry.84:
Dulce, Ivy, Otto, Bess.

Billy came to live with us again. Hot baths for Bubo’s started.
Entry.85: Boys played Cricket at Boolak. Dave Niness represents Annie’s Room. Won easily. Billy & I went through Waazaa. Met Pte. Tailly whose Frere lives in Henry St. West Kogarah.
Entry.86: Went to Kasr-el-Nil Gardens & Bridge. Met Yankee girls. Tea at Brit. Sold. Club at Esbekiah. Met Said up the Waazaa. Billy Bagnall & all watched the Dance, Vin, Ellis, Bill & I.
Entry.87:
Nancy Cohen, H. Hey, Nettie, Home, Doris.

Joined the Cricket Club & started Hot Plasters.
Entry.88: L. Porman, Home. 2 m. issued 4 pkts. Cigarettes. Dave Niness gave me 4 pkts. Billy Bagnall & I played Euchre, Crib & Casino while Ellis, Billy & Dave played Draughts.
Entry.89: Went for a tour round the Mouski. Ellis buys Blouse, I buy Gold Ash Tray. Eric & I buy oranges & dates.
Entry.90: Ellis, Billy & I played draughts. Night Wardmaster. Shifted man from Boob to 4 Sydney 12 midnuit, much language.
Entry.91: Morris’ rabbit drive. Tried to learn French verbs but am still trying. Dreamt of J. Mather again, 3rd time.
Entry.92: More Smallpox, more rabbit drives. Bread throwing stops. No leave. All Patients vaccinated.
Entry.94: Mail in. One from Bess & Os Merrett. None from Home.
Entry.96: Donkey ride, Helouan to Memphis. Tea at Anzac Hostel & Concert. Billy, Ellis & I twice across the Nile.
Entry.97: Dust storm No. 1. No Treatment afternoon. Dust everywhere & in everything.
Entry.98: Wrote Roy, Marie. Received one from Marie. Papers from Dad. Went to Heliopolis for milk & meat paste & matches. Poor jelly died in Ice Chest.
Entry.99: Pay Parade. Met Italian Consul’s daughter & L. McLean. Boys gave show at Anzac Hostel & played No. 3 Aux. Hosp. Heliopolis cricket, 188 to 90 lost.
Entry.100: Reinforcements 2 a.m. Wrote Dad, Geo. & Mum in Hut. Moved my Dressing Hut. Issue summer clothes. L. McLean out to see us.
Entry.101: Night Ward Master. Met Vic Digre.
Entry.102: Started my Hut at full strength. Went to Cairo with Billy, Earn, Dave, Ellis & met Les McLean. Met Victoria.
Entry.103: Went to Cairo with Dave Niness. Eric bought roses. Met Tommy Soldat & met Italian Girl. Received mits from Bessie.
Entry.104: Wrote to Bessie. Received letters from Home, Marge, Hilda, Bess, Nettie. Went to see Harold & Sarfry.
Entry.105: Went to Cairo with B. Bag., Earn, Dave, Billy & Ellis & met McLean. Supper at Saults . Wrote to Mr. Flaherty, Scotland.
Entry.106: Ida, H. Hey, Anne Methven. Received letter from Marie & parcels from Home. Wrote 7 pages to Marge. Played cricket against No. 4 Aux. Dave & I put on 30 runs for last wicket. Dave got 20 & I got 7 not out & caught one man. We won the match by an innings & 45 runs.
Entry.107: 7.30 to Alexandria. Swim with H. Woolcott at Ras-el-Tin. Sailed on the Harbour in the Risa. Put Mr. Charles Verrers aboard the Oxfordshire. Maltese had King.
Entry.108: Letters posted on board. Had beano Heliopolis. Wrote Mother (26).
Entry.109:
1916, Anzac Day

Wrote to Dad (27). Concert at No. 3 Gen. Wrote to Maisie & Dulcie. No treatment except for me. Won 3 Legged Race. Swim at No. 3 Gen.
Entry.110: Hot day. 111° Fah. in shade, 258° Fah. on Sand. Vaccinated again. 3 vaccinated, 8 inoculation to date.
Entry.111: Dave & I walked all round Cairo. Went to Museum & sat outside Egyptian Café to watch chicken juggler. Ellis night Ward Master. Went to Aust. Comforts fund & got 2 Bats, one was Dave Vernon’s.
Entry.112: Played Cricket, bowling for 2 hours. Canteen & Recreation Room opened. Played music for the Boys.
Entry.113: Received mail from H. Hey, Hannah & Nettie. Went to play Cricket against H.2 Staff but Vic Wright took my place. Our side 116, other side 4 wickets, 236, Stirling 100 retired. Night Ward Master. Messing about with sleeping draughts till 12.45 a.m.
Entry.114: Excused Church. Frank Cartright & Les Nettleton from Tel-el-Kebir to dinner, Kasr-el-Nil, Gehzira Gardens. Tea at Anzac & heard Welsh Choir. Met Percy Stewart.
Entry.115: Received Parcel from B. Cuneo, chocs. & socks. Wrote Home (28). Started Prophylactic Treatment.
Entry.116: Ellis leave day & we had to shift tents. Pay day & nearly all the mob were boozed. Percy Stewart on Transport work & also came over to see us at night.
Entry.117: Wrote to Hilda, Hannah, Nettie, George (29), Mem 9 pages, Kit Paine, Roy Tredrea. Received letters from Mem, Jess M., Bess, Kit Paine, Julie & Roy Tred.
Entry.118:
Official opening of Canteen. Half shica. Read books nearly all the time. Earn has fight with Picket. Ellis Orderly Corporal. Wrote Bess 
Julie
 & Jess Mather.
Entry.119: Ellis & I whole day leave. Looked for McGoodye. Lay down in Park all afternoon. Went to tea with Mrs. Wright & met Traill & Miss Hindmarch & Brother. Just Home in time. Saw Roly Hale, who told us that Eric Davis had left the Hospital. Summer starts in real earnest. Will note in Future only cool breezy days.
Entry.120: Welsh Fusiliers Band in Ezbekieh Gardens. Late pass till 12 p.m. Billy, Harrie, Dave, myself.
Entry.121: Wrote to Julie & sent 2 P.C’s Home (30). Cards to J. Mather. Wrote to Dad (31). 2 P.C. to George (32), Dave, Vernon, Ted Clarke, Miss Flaherty (Aust.). 156 letters to here.
Entry.122: Received mail from H. Hey & Bess. Ellis on the Canteen. Dave & I played Quoits. Aeroplanes chase away at Reveille to Port Said. MacLean leaves Cairo to-morrow. We go in a fortnight’s time?
Entry.123: Night Ward Master. Earn & I dress murderer in the cells & admit man at 11.15 p.m. to No. 6 Ward from Anzac Picket. Received letters from Hilda & Bessie.
Entry.124: Canteen Keeper. Recd. letter from Jennie. Horrie Norton 18 years old. Wrote to H. Hey, Bess, Jennie, Dad, 33, 2 cards.
Entry.125: Wrote to Roy, George & Mum, 34 & 35 & studied French with Eric. Another Hot day 110 in the shade. Dave saw Eric Jones & his wife on the way back to Australia.
Entry.126: Very Hot. Went to French Lesson with Eric Marshman. Billy & Dave go to Alex.
Entry.127: Ellis, Bill Bagnall & I go to Kasr-el-Nil &c. at Gippo’s dinner. Feed on Hot Green apricots without after-effects. Tea at Anzac & Home to Bed at 6 p.m.
Entry.128: No leave. No water till 8 p.m. Dave & I go to Helio. to eat Ice Cream & buy Lemon Squash. Niness gets crook on peanuts.
Entry.129: Rise at 5 a.m., treatment alters. Played cards from 2 till 4 & then started treatment. New W.O. arrives. Open Bessie’s parcel which arrives on the 15th inst.
Entry.130: Treatment at 5.45 a.m. and at 9 & 3.30 p.m. Took Len Val’s turn at Ward Master. Bed 11 p.m.
Entry.131: Wrote to Francis & Eileen. Cool day. Staff Burr’s Presentation in Rec. Room.
Entry.132: Tennis court opens. Night Ward Master. Dress the Drunken Guard’s Head & 12 minuit. Nice cool weather.
Entry.133: Nice cool day. Ellis & I go to Heliopolis to the Pictures. Walk home with H. Wooly. Walked along to the Catholic Church & it was O.K., a beautiful place. Beautiful Cedar flowers Red & salmon colour in Heliopolis. Received a letter from Marie . Hear of Johnny Norton’s Death.
Entry.134: Dodged Church again. Wrote to Home (36), Marie & Bess.
Entry.135: Received letters from Roy & Sally Flaherty. Patients parade for cigarettes. Major Mullins up for exceeding speed limit. Ellis goes back to Hut.
Entry.136: Wrote Roy. Received Photo of Group. Parcel from Bess. Letter from Maisie Hudson. Wrote to Sally Flaherty, Glasgow. Wrote to Maisie Hudson.
Entry.137:
1916, Empire Day

Wrote 4 Pages to Doris. General Altham visits camp. Mess hut burnt down by patients. Capt. Bray leaves the Hospital.
Entry.138: Moved Tent for 4th time. Letters from Dobbo’s, Francis, Dad, Mum, Rube Charles. Rube Watson, Kit Green, Mem, Jack R., Esme, Laura, Margaret. Views from Ellen Rogers, Mrs. Mel, Grandma, Mrs Clarke. Met Aub. Hick, beard.
Entry.139: Wrote to Dad (38), George, P.C. (39). Capt. Booth from Willoughby starts in my hut. Wrote to Laura, Rube Watson, Ruby Charles, Mrs. Clarke, Mrs. Mel, Grandma Davies, Chrissie (9).
Entry.140:
Wrote to Clare Langley, Francis, Kit Green. 190 letters to here. Went for French Lecon. Night Ward Master. No trouble. Have a good chat with Gen. Ryrie’s Interpreter.

for 25.5.16

Ellis goes into D. Lord’s Tent. 14 letters received, one a P.C., has no name so how am I to answer it. Wrote 8 pages to M. Millar & 2 to Mum (37).
Entry.141: Wrote Jack Preddey, Mem & Esme. Church by new Minister. Jack Tredrea. Nin & Bill with DOPE & Dev. go to Pt. Said.
Entry.142: All day leave. A.M.C.’s not to be worn & belts to be worn. Met McCoogi. Dinner at 8 a maison & tea at Groppi’s. Kasr-el-Nil Jardin & went to his office near Esbekiah Gardens.
Entry.143: Eric & I go to French. I am paraded for roll calling. Mark a man present on Parade who is in Clink. Gallagher & Dope Lord too.
Entry.144: Major Raffan receives orders to proceed to Alex. & London. Ellis & meet McCoogi. Pay day.
Entry.145: Pasted Photos in Album. Lovely Day.
Entry.146: Major Raffan goes to England. Ellis stops in bed with screws. Weather still Glorious, a bit windy this day but nothing much.
Entry.147: Warm & windy. Finish Roll Call. I go to French myself & go very well. Jump on donk. & gallop to meet Bill in Esbekiah Gardens. Met Dave instead. Saults for Soupper & Fast Train Home. Stopped opp. gates. Dope & Earn march through Jardin. Wrote to Nettie.
Entry.148: Church Parade. Hot & windy. Ellis & I go to Helio.
Entry.149: Wrote to Marg., Home (38). Nice Day again. We have only had 3 hot days so far.
Entry.150: Billy, Dave, Ellis & I go sailing on the Nile. Ice Cream Ghezireh Gardens. Tea at Anzac & Billiards at Y.M.C.A. Billy beat Dave 50, 48. I beat Ellis 50, 48. I beat Billy 50, 34. Dave beat Ellis. Had French Lecon & drinks at Saults. Letters from H. Hey, Home, Mrs. Stephen, Roy, Wal Fisher.
Entry.151: Wrote Roy. Finish No. 2 Hut. Received Photos of Marjorie Melville & letter from Nettie. Last night we met Ken Prior, Capt. of the 51st Artill. Battery at Groppi’s.
Entry.152: Start No. 2 Ward, Sydney. Went & met McCoogi. Bought 2 bottles Scent 3 P.T. Met Billy Reid & saw Jack Mitchell in a Gharry.
Entry.153: Kit inspection by Major Morris & Lieut. Teece. We pack parcel to send Home. Wrote Marjorie Melville & George (41).
Entry.154: George’s Birthday. Went to Cairo for French Lesson.
Entry.155: Church. Major Morris enjoys the Photos & decorations in my ward. Billy goes on Parade in full rig like the Camel Corps. Wrote to Mrs. Stephen & Wal Fisher.
Entry.156: Billy goes to Alex. for a Holiday. Water melon on the run home from Cairo. Met McCoogi. Went through the Belgian Count’s Home at Helio. Wrote to Hilda & Bert Cocks.
Entry.157: Night Matron. Concert in Patients Hut. Lady Godiva present. Late night.
Entry.158: Sick Parade because I was too tired to get up. Went to Choubra & eat water melon. Spent day at Soldiers Club & Dave won at billiards 100 to 86. Have only a few milliemes left. Eat Bessie’s Peaches in Esbekiah.
Entry.159: Pay day. Received letter & Photo from Cousin Jennie. Wrote to Nettie & Home (42), Mum (43).
Entry.161: Night ward master. Concert by Camel Corp in Y.M.C.A. Hut. Everybody goes out but me. Still getting lovely weather.
Entry.162: I go out alone to Band Performance and chat with two Tommies & home with Hudson. Anzac Provost in great array. Church in morning.
Entry.163: Billy arrives Home at 7 p.m. All the Tent gorge on melon.
Entry.164: Parcels arrive, one for me from Bess with chocs., cheese, peaches & Veal Paste. Ellis receives Cake & Soap & . Wrote to Mum (44), Marie.
Entry.165: Late lunch day for me. Warm day with a nice warm breeze. Billy has no trouble to keep the temperature up.
Entry.166: Billy, Dave, Ellis & I go for a sail towards Barrage. Billy & Ellis have a swim near Ghezerah Bridge. We all won a game of Billiards. All Staff moved again.
Entry.167: Blandford, Perkins, Slatree, Bolton, Taylor go to Artillery. Capt. McDowell has his say to Snowy. Wrote to Ida & Wal & Marion Clarke.
Entry.168: Billy, Ellis, Dave & I took gharry to Koobeh Gardens & walked back 2½ miles. Very tired. Wrote Mag. Dobson. Have written 215 letters to this date.
Entry.169: Wrote Lyd. Goddard & Doris Blackwell. Matron, 2 men probable enteric. Ellis & Earn go to Band. Dave & Billy go to the Kirk. Night Ward Master.
Entry.170: Wrote to Mum & George 46-47, Dad 45. Went to Heliopolis with Q.M.S. Williams. Saw Pictures & ate Peanuts. All the other Boys stayed at Home.
Entry.171: Dreamt of Nell & Fanny. Can’t remember anything very startling.
Entry.172: Dreamt again being at Church with Mum. Played Cards a lot.
Entry.173: Wrote to Bess. Met Dick Rowe. Remount Unit give concert.
Entry.174: All day leave. Saw all the Boys off to Aust. & spent day at Giza & Zoo. Dave, Bill & I played Billiards & I won one game. Dreamt of Jess, mother again.
Entry.175: Wrote Home (48), Madge, Mrs. Whitehead, Nell, Cuneo. In charge of Sydney Pavilion & put Patient Blackwell into Mel. 8.
Entry.176:
Wrote Home (49). Spent a quiet evening outside our tent listening to Phonograph. Night Matron again falls to my lot. Hooted out of Bed at 10.45 p.m. to go to Billy’s Ward.

Monday 3 July 1916

Ward Master all day. Wrote Cards to Mem, Edie Tory, Ada Cohen, I. Westaway, Jess Mather.

Tuesday 4 July 1916

Bill, Dave & I go to Cairo for a run. Visit all the Popular places.

Wednesday 5 July 1916

Ellis, Bill & I go to Heliopolis to meet Dick Rowe. Also meet McKenzie, Dinkum Soldier McKenzie. All Patients come inside the Ward. A kid of 5 talks French & English with equal ease.

Thursday 6 July 1916

Everything as usual, had a very lazy day. Lay in bed at evening & thought of Home & Friends.

Friday 7 July 1916

Late dinner day. Wrote Harry Taubman & Edie Taubman. Tried hard to rain. Staff gives a concert in Y.M.C.A. Hut. Very hot day & Earn malingers.

Saturday 8 July 1916

The 4 Jews go out to Y.M.C.A. I met Roy Ingram. Ellis wins 3 games Billiards. Dave & I beat Billy & Ellis 105 to 50. We dine at Y.M.C.A. & have a sing-song with McKenzie from Manly. Went to Anzac Hotel for Tea & concert afterwards.

Sunday 9 July 1916

2 Cards to George (50), 2 Cards Dad (51), 2 Cards Mum (52). Went to Band & met Stan Railton (Capt.). The 4 Jews & Earn go. Very hot day. I call the Rolls again.
Entry.177: I write to Jean Clarke, Ethel Vass, Margaret Millar. I go to Heliopolis for fried eggs & am fanned by the French Dame. Recd. letter from Sally Flaherty.
Entry.178: Wrote to Bess & sent Photos. Played cards. E. Thomas & others taken on the strength of the Unit. Concert by Segt. Jeffries & the Countess. Wrote Home (53) & sent Photo of Group with Earn & on boat & in shirt.
Entry.179: Night Ward Master & get plenty of work. Wrote to Cohens
Entry.180: Take 8 Patients to Ras-el-Tin. Met Aub. & McDonnell. Swim & meet Alf Nicholas. Have a real good day. 3¼ hours trip back. Trip costs 5 P.T.
Entry.181: Night Ward Master. I am tres fatigue. Photo taken of the Sydney Pavilion Staff. Wrote to Mrs. Stephen.
Entry.182: Wrote to Jennie & sent views of mountains. Wrote Home (54). Ellis, N. Morton. I write to my Mater in our Recreation Room. All the Boys go out with Dick Rowe. Recd. letters from Nell, Laura, Bess, D. & M. Cuneo, Mrs. Merrett, Nettie, Bess, Nancy, Alice Methven, Dot, Dad & Mum (2) to tell of Sickness, Maynie, Chris. Dobson, Dulcie & Hilda. News that my Mater has been ill.
Entry.183: All day leave spent at Esbekiah. Wrote to Dot Preddey. Met Roley Hale. Dinner at Y.M.C.A. H.Q. & Tea at Gardens.
Entry.184: Recd. letter from Jennie, Photo of John . Wrote to Nettie, Hilda, Dulcie, Mr. Merrett, Chris Dobson, Nance Cohen, Sally, Bess, Nell, Laura, P.M. & Jack, Alice Methven & Maynie a P.C.
Entry.185: P.C. to Dad (55), George (56), Mum 57, Roley Hale came up & we went to Y.M.C.A. Concert in Patients Hut.
Entry.186: I am transferred to Melbourne Pavilion & make a generally clean up. Major Dawson gets his majority.
Entry.187: Ellis & I go to see Roley Hale at No. 3 Gen. Meet Capt. Caines in Wash house. We go to Heliopolis & have fried steak & onions. Lovely weather but we get very tired of Pine Apples all
Entry.188: Night turn & in Charge of Mel. all day. Wounded scare. Patients & all give a hand to get Beds & fittings next door. Ellis attached till 10 p.m. & some Boys stay all night.
Entry.189: Mel. on my own all day. No leave. Ellis goes to sick ward. Mrs. Chisholm brings the Shepherd’s Hotel Orchestra to play in the Y.M.C.A. Hut. They are excellent. Ellis goes to No. 8 Ward with C. Holt & H.O.K.
Entry.190: Inspection by outsider at 5.45 p.m. I meet Mr. Nicholas, go to the Band. Came Home with Annie’s Room.
Entry.191: Mac goes to Ras el Tin. 33 men come from Sydney Pav. I have jelly & cocoa in No. 8 & play Bridge. B. & D. go on leaf. Get letters from Home, George, Bess, Marg., Jess, Julie & Mem.
Entry.192: Full Dress Inspection. Molly picks her Boy. I ride to Abbassia & call at McCougi’s. Dinner & go to Cairo. Meet Roley Hale & play Billiards. Met McCougi & go to Pictures with Maltese Dames.
Entry.193: Went to see Dick Rowe at Pyramids Bar. Ellis & I, we talk with two Pommys & listen to Gippo songs on Phonograph.
Entry.194: Wrote to Jess, Julie & Mem. Ellis & I go to Cairo, meet Cougi & ride back to Heliopolis Hotel with Maltese Lady. It is very nice.
Entry.195: I go to Cairo for my Photos. Meet Kinna & Ice Cream, Lemonade & Peanuts. Wrote to Bess, Marg., Lily, Mum (58).
Entry.196: I play Cricket at 6 p.m. & nothing else is worthy of note. Send Photo to Jennie.
Entry.197:
Ellis & I go to Ferra Sudan for Dinner. Mrs. Cougi plays Le Piano & we dine on stuffed fowl & Chicken Soup with Grapes as Desert. We spend the evening outside 

Saults. I am Matron & forget all about it but nothing happens. Good Luck.
Entry.198: Send Photo to Mum & Mr. Westy & letter. Photo to Lyd. Goddard, George (60), Photo to Bess, Marj., Mel, Alice Meth. Papers Received.
Entry.199: Dave & I go on Donks through the Dead City & Khalif on to Nap’s Fort. We dine at Y.M.C.A. & meet E.B. Old & Matt to play Billiards. We had to hurry back at 5 p.m. We had a very good day. Letter from Marie. Wrote Home (61) & Marie.
Entry.200: Supposed to have written to Maisie Carter on the 1st August.
Entry.201: I begin to play Football. We go to Luna Park & have a very nice time.
Entry.202: Nettie’s Natal Day. Commen. of start of war. Church at 9.45 a.m. Downes leaves us.
Entry.203: Wrote Home (62), Pictures of a quiet drink in Cairo. Photo to Nettie. I practise Hymns for Church. We all go to Cairo but D.E. & I go to Anzac & take supper.
Entry.204: Played Piano for Church. Played too loud, gave no breathing time & no expression. Malish.
Entry.205: Sick Parade. I get a cold from Playing Football.
Entry.206: One letter from Bess. Went next door & watched arrival of 130 Turkish Prisoners.
Entry.207: Leave all day. Played Billiards, saw Australian wounded come in to Cairo. Dinner Y.M.C.A., Tea at Groppi’s.
Entry.208: I go on S.P. 2 days, no drill. Cois Cateer. Play Cards with neighbours W.D. & Tommy W.
Entry.209: Ward Master. Finish top floor of Mel. Pav. Work finishes.
Entry.210: Route March. I am well away. I am O. Corp. & Postman. I help sort letters. I get 2 from Home, one Hilda & one May Coppin. Parade at 4 p.m. & I don’t hear the Bugle. Shepherd’s Band plays Y.M.C.A. Dick Rowe comes to Tea.
Entry.211: General Duties. Dave, Jeff C. & myself go to see the Tennis Finals at Cairo. We end up at Luna Park.
Entry.212: I go for a route march for the first time all round Heliopolis. It is no good & I get back hot, tired & dopey. Wrote to Os. Merrett. Join Tennis Club.
Entry.213: Pay Day. Wrote Dad (63). Wrote Mum (64), Hilda, Mrs. Whitehead. Night Ward Master 11 p.m.
Entry.214: Take Patients to Cairo at 6 a.m. Boys go on march. Wrote to Mrs. Stephen, May Coppin & 2 Sydney Views to Jennie Lawton. I play Cards all night with B. E. T. & myself.
Entry.215: Leave all day. Buy Ink Stand in Mouski & play Billiards with D. Get badly beaten by D. Tea at Petrograd with E. & D. Lord.
Entry.216: Go off General Duties. Start night Duties from 8 p.m. to 7 a.m. We all move over to Sydney Pav. with the Bugs. Sleep between 3 & 4 & 4.20 & 5. Wake all time. Wrote Dot.
Entry.217: Go off Duty at 7 a.m. Sleep? till noon. Sargents have a bust up till 11.30. I sneak 4 hours sleep. All Sergeants well oiled.
Entry.218: Play for Church. No sleep. D., E. & I go to old Cairo to see cutting of Khalig. We meet two Gentlemen in the Royal Salon. I come home for Duty & E. & D. go Feasting.
Entry.219: I play Tennis & play the Piano. Ellis goes to Cairo for Films & comes Home in a side car. Wrote to Marg. & Maisie Carter.
Entry.220: Mail Day. E.T. gets 4 letters. Letters from D. Vernon, Dad, Bess, Otto, H. Hey, Mum & George.
Entry.221: Wrote to H. Hey & D.C. Vernon, Otto & Annie (5) & Jess Mather, Bess. Ellis plays tennis & hurts his foot. The mob have Physical Jerks.
Entry.222: Wrote Home (65). Very windy, dusty day. E.T. Condon & I dine in Chanchie Alley on Tomatoes, apricots, Bread, butter & coffee.
Entry.223: Ellis goes to No. 3. Dave & I go to Cairo & Old Cairo Cemetery. I take Photo & Beat D. at Billiards. I still go on Night Duty yet no sleep. Hot Fom. from 3 to 6.30 on one chap.
Entry.224: Leave all day starts from 9 a.m. to 9.30 p.m. I go to Cairo for Film. I go off night Duty & have no Duty at all. I receive letters from Dad, Mum, Maisie Carter, Julie, Nettie.
Entry.225: Play for church in recreation room. Write to George (66), Nettie, Madge Willett. Went on duty from 5.30 p.m. to 9.30 p.m., wrote to Julie, Hannah, Miss Niness, M. Carter. Relieved Sam Cramer.
Entry.226: Photo taken of Unit in a sweltering sun. E., B. & I go to Helio., see Pyramids Bar show. Pictures excellent.
Entry.227: E., B. & I go to Cairo & I take my boots. I Beat W. by 55 at Billiards & 3 out of 4 games at draughts. We meet staff L. Col. & shews us why the war will last till September 1917.
Entry.228: Received letters from Nell, Laura, Dulce, Dad, Clare Langley, Nettie, Hilda, E. & M. Miles. Played 2 sets Tennis. Wrote to Bess, Clare, Mrs. Clarke. Wrote to Roy, Ida & Wal., Dad (67), Mum (68), Dulce, E. & M. Miles, Nettie, Hilda.
Entry.229: Orderly Corporal. I write to Nell & Laura, Frances & Eileen. We feed on Biscuits, cheese, figs, grapes & dates. Wrote Jennie. Wrote to Nell, Laura, E. & Frances Burke (2), Eileen Stirling.
Entry.230: D., E. & I go to Pyramids. Tea at Pyramids & go to Aldershot Room. Ride in Gippo Bus. Finish at Saults. Gippo cooking starts & is very good.
Entry.231: I go to Heliopolis to get seeds but fail. I meet B. W. I. & Dave Niness. I scale W.H.A.
Entry.232: Piano in case & I play Hymns. Very awkward & very faint sound. All the singers get out of Tune. I play a wrong note in opening Hymn. Pack up for Sedy Bishr.
Entry.233: 50 of us left Abbassia for Sidi Bishr at 6.30. Arrive at base camp about noon. Swim as soon as Dinner was over. Everything lovely. Meet C. Gibson on Cairo Station & he goes to Sidi Bishr & camps.
Entry.234: 3 tents away after 17 years. We have Lecture & S.A. Parade & Concert at night.
Entry.235: The Party goes to Alex. to see the Catacombs. We find them not & go to Baths at Ras el-Tin. Afterwards go on Pier & listen to music, afterwards Tea & Cleopatra Street. I ride on the motor to camp.
Entry.236: Capt. Orchard & party go sailing. Tea & a lovely day’s outing. All Donkey ride Home. I see Miss Brooks party & hear Her sing.
Entry.237: Nothing doing. We go on big beach & enjoy surf shooting morning & evening. We all have a blow out at the Refreshment Room. Concert at Y.M.C.A. We get news to go.
Entry.238: We have issue of Cigarettes & leave Sidi Bishr at 9.30 & march to Tram. We join up at 10.30 & pitch our moving Tent. 10 in a tent. We have a swim & the black flag goes down. I receive letters from Amy Cocks, Auntie Annie, Home, M. Westaway. Play Cards & have soup in Recreation Room.
Entry.239: I go on S.P. I receive 3 letters from Home, Bess, Marion Clarke, Mem, Esme, Nettie, M. Millar, George, Bertha, Dailies, Alma Whitehead, Farry. Wrote to Aunt Annie & Mum (69), Dad (70), George (63).
Entry.240: Full Dress Inspection. We find bones in the sand of our Camp. More letters from Home (3), Marg., Bess, Ida Mull., Hilda, Dot Preddey, Nettie. Wrote Bess, Marg., Mem, Esme, Dot, Amy, Bert.
Entry.241: Route march to Caesar’s Camp. Wrote to Dad (72), Mum (73), Bess, Hilda & Peggy (11). Went to Concert in Gymnasium. I hear Otto’s song “How dare you". Tenor sings “Give me the light", the “Swankers" sing “Keep the Kettle Boiling Mary while I’m away".
Entry.242: I am Ord. Corp. Receive letter from Dad with £5, Mrs. Merrett & Whitehead. I answer Dad’s (74). I have a nice walk to the Officers’ Quarters 7 times. Dave, Ellis, Billy & Earn go to Alex.
Entry.243: Route March to Caesar’s Camp. Wrote Mrs. Merrett. Sea like glass & we swim out in the deep basin, other Australians go aboard Warilda? Wrote Mrs. Whitehead, Mum (75) & Peggy.
Entry.244: We leave the Grave Yard Camp & take tram right to the Docks. We have a long walk along the Quays to Gloucester Castle. We go aboard about 11 a.m. & sail at 5 p.m. Scotty’s gramop. plays Fishers Hornpipe Medley.
Entry.245:
Rise at 5.30 after being wakened by Pretty Night Nurse. Everything very nice. Sea Calm. Boat Drill 4 p.m. Nothing to write Home about.

Sent black bags to Wharf for Transport on 11.9.16, also wrote to Maynie, Ida Mulligan, Marion Clarke, Farry, Nettie, Alma Whitehead.
Entry.246: I play for Church opp. Isle of Patmos. We enter the Archipeligo before sun rise. Islands on either side all the way. We have a gale & I am cold for the first time for a long while.
Entry.247: We go aboard the Aquitania before 5 p.m. We have good meals & beds & a sing song after Tea. Nothing to write about. After a blow on the Top of the Deck, I take 130 steps down to my Bunk.
Entry.248: I see my First Dirrigable Baloon. We unload the Candover Castle & get supper. We learn some of the different ways about the ship. We don’t go to our Quarters till Lights out.
Entry.249: We set sail from Mudros Harbour at 7 a.m. We see 4 Subs. of our own going to Lemnos, after we leave the Harbour. We saw dozens of Islands some inhabited. We made good pace but nothing eventful occurs. We attain a speed of 24 knots during the night.
Entry.250: Avail myself of Library. Nothing to do or write. Concert for Patients. Sailed out of rough sea in morning to calm sea in afternoon. Saw Sicily in the far North.
Entry.251: Steamed along North African coast. Saw a submarine but did not know whether French or German. Read from Library about Grimsby & have herring for Tea & Pork for Dinner. Concert for us. Gen. Street.
Entry.252: Saw Spain as soon as I came on deck. Passed Gib. & 2 Nth Africa Towns. Saw porpoises in Straights & passed a floating mine.
Entry.253: I am Ord. Corp. We see a school of whales about 5 p.m. We pass Finisterre & enter the Bay of Biscay.
Entry.254: Passed through the Bay. Water choppy but not rough. Nothing to write or note.
Entry.255: Arrived in Southampton Roads. Saw Osborne House, I. of Wight, many seaplanes & aeroplanes, Destroyers, arrived at 6 a.m. Rainy but sun comes out before Dinner.
Entry.256: We go into the Wharf & see all the Patients off. We go for a walk to the Dock gates but cannot get out. We see the People & P.O. officers. We have supper on Bananas & chocolates. I write to Mum, Marg., Aunt Annie & Jennie. I look at a monitor.
Entry.257: Sent cable. We arrive at Tidworth No. 2 Parkhouse Farm. We have a long 4 mile march. E. B. & I go for a walk after 7 p.m. to the Village & Back. I meet Billy Read again. We eat Blackberries & that’s all.
Entry.258: I wrote Home 7 pages. Rainy & no afternoon Parade. Hot & cold showers & to bed at 7 p.m. We go route marching before Breakfast & Drill afterwards.
Entry.259: Dave & I go to Shipton Church. I play the organ & watch Decorations for Harvest Festival. We go to Tidsworth & eat Dough Nuts & Custard Tarts in the Market Place. We watch Soccer match & walk round the Lanes & Village. We meet Billy at 6.15 & go for a walk again. We have supper in the Village & arrive Home at 8.55 after a 55 minutes walk.
Entry.260: Church Parade & General inspection by Gen. Moore. D., B., E. & I go to Shipton but fail to get to Salisbury. We motor to Tidsworth for Supper & walk Home. We tour village for grub.
Entry.261: No parade morning & route march in afternoon. Wrote Dad, Mum & George, Marg., Maynie, Marie, Jennie. I get a change of Boots. Recd. letter Marie 17/9/16.
Entry.262: We route march to Cholderton & see a 50 Dennis Motor Transport. Heaps of drill all afternoon. Go to bed very early as we are all tres fatigue.
Entry.263: I am on Y.M.C.A. Fatigue. I meet Dougall Carroll & mud-guts. Route march in afternoon, go to bed early. Write to Bess.
Entry.264: 3 route marches. We get leave. I wash clothes. See Tocooloo Roberts at Cholderton & visit old church. Wrote Jennie & Roy.
Entry.265: No route march after 9 till 2 p.m. Very rainy.
Entry.266: Ern goes on Guard. D., B., E. & I go to Shipton & return to Y.M.C.A. We have supper on bacon & eggs. Mick Barr goes to France & bids Bill Good-Bye.
Entry.267: Church Parade. We walk to Shipton & motor to Tidworth. Motor runs out of Benzine at X Roads. We arrive in London. Visit Fleet St., see St. Pauls.
Entry.268: Arrive L/pool. Visit Town Hall. Dine & Play billiards at Angel Hotel. Arrive Douglas at 5 p.m. Meet Marie. 8.5 train to Sulby. Arrive Home 10 p.m. at Vicarage. Meet Grandma, Auntie & Uncle. Wrote Mum.
Entry.269: Blackberry Day. Uncle takes us for a walk. I sprain my wrists. Ellis & Dave go out & I sit at the Fireside on the mat not on the seat. We have plenty of music. Aunt Hannah arrives.
Entry.270: I do not go out. Ellis & Dave shoot & gather mushrooms. I again sit by the fire & more music at night. I say Good night & sleep for the first time & dream of Grandma’s other farm.
Entry.271: I arise at 4.20 & make fire. We drive with Auntie to Railway. Meet Uncle Harry for an hour. We reach L’pool after a rough passage. Leave L’pool at 5.30, arrive London 10.5. Union Jack.
Entry.272: Leave London 6.15, arrive Andover & motor to Parkhouse, too late. We join our ranks at Bulford, start Duty at 2 p.m. Everything very nice. I write Mar. 6 pages.
Entry.273:
Have easy time. Some black bags arrive. I write Home. I had letters from Bess (2), H. Hey (2), M. Hudson, 5 from Home, Jess Mather, Mem.

Motor breaks down on Friday. I learn of Ted Clarke’s death. I was very sick until this morning. I can’t sleep in M’s bed but sleep on the floor very well.
Entry.274: Canteen Corporal. Wrote Dad, Mum, Marie & Auntie Annie. Glorious day. Sent & flowers. Also Night on, but had to finish letters in Canteen. Very cold.
Entry.275: Voting Day. Glorious Day. Dave & I go to the Pictures. Very good turn of Musique. Girl dancer & contortionist. I buy tin opener in village.
Entry.276: Cold very bad. I go into 3 Ward. Very hard day. I write to Jennie when on duty in the fumigation. Pay Parade, get 15/-. Col. speaks to Boys on 2 p.m. parade. Wrote Jennie.
Entry.277: Still Ward 3A. Transferred to Syph. Division with Ellis. Began duties as my younger Brother Batman. Wrote to Bess & Maisie.
Entry.278: Wrote to H. Hey, Mem, Jess M. & Chris Dobson. A one legged patient comes in. One of Earn’s Patients meets His brother after 14 years in His ward.
Entry.279: We take up our Lodgings in No. 4 Hut. We have now a nice Home & everything is O.K. The first batch of our Boys go to the Infantry. Letter from Auntie Annie & Roy.
Entry.280:
Receive letters from Marie, Billy & I take out our washing & go to Pictures. We have lovely weather. I write to Marie but do not finish letter.

Saw Col. Raffan & dreamt about Him too.
Entry.281: Letters from Auntie & Jennie. Meet Tom Lindsay. Go to church. Tom Lindsay comes to supper & Ellis, E. & I sup on peaches, cream, cocoa & toast. Wrote an 8 p. F.cap Auntie Annie.
Entry.282: Wrote Jennie in Canteen. One Patient robbed. Parcel arrives from Auntie, mustard & oxo. Dream all night, M.
Entry.283: G.S. comes back off leave. Dave & I go to Pictures & hear about the Manx Cat. We go to late session. Receive letters from Jennie 15/10/16 to Egypt & Jack Preddey. Wrote to Roy.
Entry.284: Wrote to Auntie Annie. E. & I go to Canteen for Supper. N.Z. Soldats march in with Bugle Band.
Entry.285: Wrote Jennie. Recd. letter from Marie. Nothing doing. No news at all.
Entry.286: Recd. letter from Bess & Tot. P. We have the humbug of the 27 Patients in the rain & wind. Sgt. Major gets away to Weymouth. I write to M.L. Very busy Day. I wear slacks.
Entry.287:
Recd. letters from Maynie, Queenie, Francis, Hilda H., Marg., Jennie, George, Mum, Dad (2), Dulcie, Bess, Ada, Jess Mather, Nettie.

Boys play football. D., E. & I go to see “Some girls". It is O.K. We eat chocs. We are again wakened at 3 a.m. to have Tea & cake. I have it. Ellis goes to sleep.
Entry.288: B. meets Alick Bax. Receive Parcel from Bess. Very wet & rainy. I didn’t go to church. Wrote to Dad (3 cards), Mum (Xmas card), Mum. Sent view to Marie.
Entry.289: Recd. letter from Marie. Wrote Dad, Geo., Jennie & P.C. to Bess. I am Canteen Corp. & don’t go on Duty till 8.40 p.m. Marg. & Dulce & Marie 2 P.C’s.
Entry.290: Wrote to Marie. Major Raffan visits us. Ellis mags all night so that I can’t write. I finish up about 10.30 p.m.
Entry.291: We fix the Electric Light on properly. Wrote to Maynie & Queenie. Dave comes over for supper.
Entry.292: Receive letters from Roy & I go out for my washing & send films to be developed. Wrote to Frances, Nettie, Jack Preddey & Ada Cohen. Ellis & I go to the Pictures.
Entry.293: Recd. letter from Marie. Wrote to H. Hey, Dad, Roy & Marie.
Entry.294:
Ellis goes to Amesbury with W. Ham. Nin & I go to Tuti-Fruiti. We take Photos round the Ground. Gen. Moore comes around. I get a new pair of Boots. Staff issued with Cigarettes.

Ellis meets Leo. Baker in Amesbury. I dream about M. & apricots.
Entry.295: Very wild day. I go to Church. Receive letter from Jennie. Send Egyptian inkstand & seeds Home to George. Toppin comes to Supper.
Entry.296: Gen. Inspec. Sent Cards to O. G. H. M. & Gran, Dobsons, Allison, Nettie, Cuneo, Whiteheads, Cohens. Recd. letters Laura, Mrs. Stephen, Bess & Home. Dave & I go towards Bulford but turn back & go to Pictures. Wrote M.R.L.
Entry.297: Letter from Mary, Westy. Wrote to Dad with P.C’s & Aunty Hannah’s Card. Letter to Dad. Card to Ida & Wal.
Entry.298: Wrote to Laura & talked. A.O.C. Commis. first. Wrote Mrs. Stephen.
Entry.299: Wrote Marie, Dad. Sent 4 Photos to Marie & 8 to Dad, Mum & George. Recd. all films & ordered Book. Bought P.C’s. Talked A.O.C.
Entry.300: A letter from M.R.L. & Auntie H. Edie Taubman writes & Otto puts a note in. Letters from Dad, Mum, Mem, Ossie & wife. Parcel from Jess Mather. Wrote Marie & Auntie, Card Home. Wrote Mrs. Niness, Edie, Marg., Rube Watson.
Entry.301: Wrote Maynie & Bess. E. & D. go to watch Footy. All go to theatre, “All aboard", no good. We cannot have Roll Call on morning parade ‘cos it’s too dark. I learn of how to make money by the sale of Egyptian coins.
Entry.302: D. Lord’s frere visits us & “dope" is away at Codford. I write to Jennie & M.R.L. Play for Kirk. I receive 1/- payment for a favour, i.e., passing two me through gate. Horrid.
Entry.303: We disch. men to P. House Camp. We receive Reinforcements. Ellis sits down opp. old Tom Adams. I go to Footy meeting. Take Val’s turn on Canteen & go up to Canteen at 9.10 to shut it. Write to M.R.L. Gundy develops Films. Recd. letter from Marie.
Entry.304: Wrote to Mum, Nettie, Mem. Dreadful fog last night. We have a lot of trouble to make Toast but succeed at last. Dave walks to Park House & gets tired. Ellis goes to Theatre with Swallow. He is very annoyed at it. Sand. supper.
Entry.305: Ellis finds Jennie’s letter in his pocket while Sgt. Elwin is speaking about it. I post it off with a note appended. Pay day. We go to bed early. Sgt. Major Swallow bans us. Nin goes to London.
Entry.306: Nothing Doing. I buy Album & paste Photos in. So to bed early. Dave comes back from London at 1 a.m., goes to Putney & wishes He had stayed there.
Entry.307: Very cold. Received Comforts Shirts, Cigs., Cakes, Cocoa & Milk. More reinforcements arrive. Receive P.C. that Tom Porman is missing since 4.8.16. Wrote to Os Merrett & Dad.
Entry.308: Snow. Ellis marches to P. House. Snow begins to fall. Receive letters, Poetry Book & Photos from Marie. Play Football in the snow. Very slippy & greasy. Lose by 18 to Nil. I get cramp in leg getting over fence. Have hot bath & Tea. Write to Marie. Snow falling heavier. Dream about all the Cohen’s in Australia & Pretty fille like M. Westy.
Entry.309: Receive letter from Jennie. 1st snow on ground. After first parade we start snowballing. I stopped the first snowball in the ear. I take 30 men to P. House & lose 2. Dreadful walk. Come back in Car, 2 hours drive, very cold. Dinner 3 p.m. & very very tired, go to bed early.
Entry.310: Go to “Swats the Matter" with D. & E. Very good. M. is leading Girl. Perfect Day & long long Trail. Capt. Brian Mack comes to stay. I put in for leave to Grimsby.
Entry.311: Receive letter from Roy. I’m Canteen Corporal. Write to Mum & Jess. Very foggy too. We have sausage & beans for supper. Dave Lord tells us that Molyneaux was at Park House.
Entry.312: Frost very bad. All pools of water become Ice. I get letter from Alice Meth. Equip B. Ward. So to bed at 7.30 p.m. We are awakened in the wee sma hours to give a Hypo. Syringe. Receive letter from Alice Methven.
Entry.313: Letters from Dad, Mum, H. Hey, Dad, M.R.L., Chris, Lyd. Goddard, Bess (2), Nell Cueno. Have the job fixing up the A. Prov. Corp Guard. Nice wind blowing. Write to Roy, M.R.L.
Entry.314: Wrote to Jennie. Dave comes over. Receive letter from May Coppin per A. Bull. Turn down weekend leave.
Entry.315: Go to Amesbury with D. & Party. Nice walk there. Visit old church. Very interesting. Walk Home in dark. Oh, the mud & slush. Go straight to Bed with vows never to go to Amesbury again. Brittania sunk & Sister ship the Gloucester Castle. We are very lucky to come through. Amesbury very quiet like Flemington near Sydney. All trees bare.
Entry.316: Go to Church. Ellis goes out. Corp. Lawrence & Rex Potter visit me. Receive letter from George. Write to Dad, Mum, George & Auntie Annie.
Entry.317: Recd. letters Bess (2), Laura, Nell, Hilda, Gwen, Eil. Stirling, Eil. Burke, Otto, Mrs. Stephen, Jess, Wally, Marion, Jean, M.R.L. 4 from Home, George. Went to see “When love creeps into your heart".
Entry.318: Letter recd. from Bess. Canteen Corporal. Wrote to Mrs. Clarke & Laura. Hard frost in morning. All Taps frozen up. P.O.W. patients go to Pictures. I get Room Warmers to work with in Test Hut. Cold in head coming on.
Entry.319: Wrote N. Cuneo, short note to M.R.L. (5). Very sick to-day with cough. No good for anything.
Entry.320: Cold much better. Recd. 2 letters from Home, Oct. 21, one from Aunt Annie, letter from Home dated
Entry.321: Wrote Dad, Mum & George, P.C. each, Bess card & 2 pages to M.R.L.
Entry.322: Wrote to Mum & Aunt A. Nothing doing. I am pretty sick. I read & loaf all day. I am also on milk diet.
Entry.323: Ellis goes to London with Dave Williams one to Richmond & one to Windsor. I go to see Dave who is sick in bed. I write to Marg. Millar.
Entry.324: Letter from Roy. Say adieu to Horrie Norton. Ellis comes home at 2.30 a.m. Write H. Hey. Write to Dot, Alice Meth., Otto, John Sawton, Roy, M.R.L.
Entry.325: Jim, Rob & I go to see “Oh, I say". Very very good. I have kick of Football with G. Parker. Recd. letter Otto.
Entry.326: Recd. letter from H. Hey, Home & Marion Clarke. Again kick footy. Nothing doing.
Entry.327: Recd. 2 letters from Marie. I have a long day but play football again. Write to M.R.L. (7).
Entry.328: Orderly Room over P. House. Escapees. Footy with A. Bull. Wrote Bert Cocks. Sent “Punch" to George.
Entry.329: Ord. Room over P.H. Escapees. Recd. Tin from Bess Cuneo. Very foggy. 3 men bad eyes come in & get loot. Wrote to Maynie.
Entry.330: Recd. letter from Jennie. Did not go out till evening & E., D. & I went to Oh I say. Very good again. Front seats cois cateer.
Entry.331: Wrote Marion Clarke, Eileen Stirling, Dobboes, Jennie. Patients go to Sacred Concert. Cold very bad again. Church nice & warm. Snow for two hours. Change my Bed.
Entry.332: Snow. Snow again large flakes. Recd. letter from M.R.L. Nothing doing. Very nasty day & my cough is very bad. Dream May Coppin, Win Cocks. Wrote M.R.L.
Entry.333: Recd. letter & Photo from Bess. Very sick to-day. Wrote to Mrs. Stephen, Jess Sheldon, Eileen Burke, Gwen, Mum, Lyd Goddard, May Coppin, Otto, H. Hey, Bess. Rotten Day but did good work.
Entry.334: Very sick. Stay in Room all day. Dream of M.R.L. & Motor Bike Ride. I lengthen overcoat sleeves & face bottoms.
Entry.335: Ice. Freezing all day. Taps frozen up all day. Recd. letters from Doris, Esme, Nettie, Dulce, Ida Dean, H. Hey, Alma Whitehead, George, Card from H. Hickson & Eileen Burke. Dream again. Nobody takes parade.
Entry.336: Ice. Recd. letter from Roy & Bess. Wrote to Eileen Burke & P.C. to France.
Entry.337: Ice. Recd. letter from Jennie. D. E. & I go to see Play. N.T.B. I take plenty of Toffee & Bottle Medicine. Have row with W.H.A. I try for Xmas leave & fail.
Entry.338: Ice. No church. I write P.C. Maud Catell. P.C. to Lily & George, letter to Roy & George started.
Entry.339: Ice. Recd. card from Home & Book from D.Js. I go on with M’s Photo album. Make good progress. Go to bed late.
Entry.340: Recd. letter & Photo from Marg. & letter from Marie. I’m Canteen Corporal but write to M.R.L. & send cards to Gran, Auntie & Jennie. Ellis goes out for a walk & has Photo taken. Meet Bill Drummond.
Entry.341: Raining like the deuce. Footy match off. I go on with my Photo Book after Wellard has gone. Haughton & Goode are discharged.
Entry.342: I go to the Pictures on my own. Dave arrives back after a Tour of the Southern Provinces.
Entry.343: I write to Jennie, George, Roy & M.R.L. Dave comes over for a yarn. Ellis goes in to the Theatre for operations.
Entry.344: Vin comes to Theatre with Ellis & I. I send Photos to M.R.L. Sapho at Theatre no good. Rotten show. New Padre arrives. I practice Hymns for Church.
Entry.345:
Lovely warm & balmy Day. Go to Kirk as usual. Practise Xmas Hymns. Receive Red X Gift. Write to Home, Bess, Ida Wilson, Ida Dean, Dulce. 
Bess
Entry.346: Had 3 good meals. Unfurled the flag. Play Hymn O Come all ye Faithful wrong Intro. Had bonnie day. Nice weather. Wrote Aunt Ann, Home, Doris, Esme, Alma, Marg.
Entry.347: D. E. I go to see A Pair of Silk Stockings. Play very good.
Entry.348: Recd. Toffee & Chocs. from Auntie Annie, very good.
Entry.349: I buy an “Onoto" pen. Wrote to Aunt Annie. Canteen Corporal again.
Entry.350: Wrote to M.R.L. Canteen Corporal again. Ellis goes on a joy ride to Fargo.
Entry.351: Sent Parcel to Roy. Recd. letter & Photo from Bert C., P.C. & letter from Jennie. Letters from Mrs. Whitehead, Maisie Carter. Go to Pictures with Dave. Meet Bill Drummond again. Ern Thomas meets C.D. Bell at Lark Hill. Wrote to H. Hey. Send Book to M.R.L.
Entry.352: Ellis stays in bed. I receive Parcels from Marion Clarke & H. Hey. Cards recd. from Laura & Clare, Letter from Mem & H. Hey. Wrote to M.R.L. 514 letters to Here. Night Duty.
Entry.353: Wrote Jennie, Home, Bertha, Clare, H. Hickson, Marion Clarke, L. Cuneo, Mrs. Whitehead.
